title: 27.伊文斯
paragraphs: 回到大学半年后，叶文洁就承担了一个重大课题：一个大型射电天文观测基地的设计。不久，她就同课题组一起外出为基地选址。最初的考虑是纯技术上的，与传统的天文观测不同，射电天文对大气质量和可见光干扰的要求不高，但要尽量避免非可见光频段的电磁干扰。他们跑了许多地方，最后选择了一个电磁环境最优的地点，这是西北的一个偏僻山区。
这里的黄土山上几乎没什么植被，水土流失产生的裂谷使山地远远看去像老人布满皱纹的面孔。在初步选定了几个建站点后，课题组在一个大部分民屋都是窑洞的村庄旁停留休整，村里的生产队长似乎认定叶文洁是个有学问的人，就问她是否会讲外国话——她问是哪国话，队长说不知道——要是会讲，他就派人上山把白求恩叫下来，队里有事同他商量。
“白求恩？”叶文洁很惊奇。
“俺们也不知道那个外国人的名字，都那么叫他。”
“他给你们看病吗？”
“不，他在后山上种树，已经种了快三年了。”
“种树？干什么？”
“他说是为了养鸟，一种照他的说法快要绝种的鸟。”
叶文洁和同事们都很惊奇，就请队长带他们去看看。沿着山路登上了一个小山顶后，队长指给他们看，叶文洁眼前一亮——看到这贫瘠的黄土山之间居然有一片山坡被绿树林覆盖，像是无意中滴到一块泛黄的破旧画布上的一小片鲜艳的绿油彩。

叶文洁一行很快见到了那个外国人，除了他的金发碧眼和身上穿的那套已经破旧不堪的牛仔服，看上去与当地劳作一生的农民已经没什么两样，甚至连他的皮肤也被晒成了当地人一样的黄黑。他对来访者似乎兴趣不大，自我介绍叫麦克·伊文斯，没说自己的国籍，但他的英语带有很明显的美国口音。他住在林边两间简陋的土坯房中，房里堆满了植树工具：锄头、铁锨和修剪树枝用的条锯等，都是当地很粗笨的那种。酉北的沙尘在那张简陋的床和几件简单的炊具上落了一层，床上堆了许多书籍，大都是生物学方面的，叶文洁注意到有一本彼得。辛格的《动物解放》。能看到的现代化的玩意儿就是一台小收音机，里面的五号电池用完了，在外面接了一节一号电池，还有一架旧望远镜。伊文斯说，很抱歉不能请他们喝什么，咖啡早就没有了，水倒是有，可他只有一个杯子。
“您在这里到底做什么呢？”叶文洁的一个同事问。
“当救世主。”
“救……救当地人吗？这里的生态环境确实是……”
“你们怎么都这样？！”伊文斯突然爆发出一股莫名的怒气，“难道只有拯救人类才称得上救世主，而拯救别的物种就是一件小事？是谁给了人类这种尊贵的地位？不，人不需要救世主，事实上他们现在过得比应得的好多了。”
“听说你在救一种鸟？”

“是的，一种燕子，是西北褐燕的一个亚种，学名很长我就不说了。每年春天，它们沿着远古形成的固定迁徙路线从南方返回时，只能把这一带作为目的地，但这里的植被一年年消失，它们已经找不到可以筑巢和生活的树丛了。当我在这里发现它们时，这个种群的数量已不足万只，这样下去五年内这个物种就会灭绝。现在，我种的这片树林给一部分燕子提供了一个落脚点，种群数量已经开始回升，当然，我还要种更多的树，扩大这个伊甸园的面积。”
伊文斯让叶文洁他们拿着望远镜看，在他的指引下，大家看了半天，才在树丛中看到了几只黑灰色的鸟儿出没。
“很不起眼，是吗？它们当然没有大熊猫那样引人注目，在这个世界上，每天都有这样不为注意的物种灭绝。”
“这些树都是你一个人种的吗？”
“大部分是，开始时我也雇当地人来干，可很快没有那么多钱了，树苗和引水什么的都很花钱……可你们知道吗？我父亲是亿万富翁，他是一个跨国石油公司的总裁，但他不再给我钱，我也不想用他的钱了。”

伊文斯的话匣子打开了，滔滔不绝地说下去，“我十二岁那年，我父亲公司的一艘三万吨级的油轮在大西洋沿岸海域触礁，两万多吨的原油泄人海中。当时，我们一家正在距事故发生海域不远处的度假别墅中。父亲得知这消息后，首先想到的是如何推卸责任和减小自己公司的损失。那天下午，我来到了那片地狱般的海岸，看到大海已变成黑色，海浪在黏稠油膜的压迫下变得平滑而无力；海滩也被一层黑油覆盖。我和一些志愿者就在这黑滩上寻找那些还活着的海鸟，它们在油污中挣扎着，一个个像是用沥青做成的黑色雕塑，只有那一双双眼睛还能证明自己是活物，那油污中的眼睛多少年以后还常常在我的噩梦中出现。我们把那些海鸟浸泡在洗涤液中，想把它们身上的油污洗掉，但十分困难，油浆和羽毛死死地粘在一起，稍用力羽毛就和油污一起一片片掉下来……傍晚，那些海鸟大部分还是死了。当时我浑身油污地瘫坐在黑色的海滩上，看着夕阳在黑色的大海上落下，感觉这就是世界末日了。”

“父亲不知什么时候来到我身后，他问我是否记得那副小恐龙骨架。我当然记得，那是在石油勘探中发现的，很完整，父亲花大价钱把它买了下来，安放到外公的庄园里。父亲接着说：麦克，我给你讲过恐龙是怎样灭绝的，一颗小行星撞击了地球，世界先是一片火海，然后陷人漫长的黑暗与寒冷……那天夜里你被噩梦吓醒了，你说梦中自己回到了那个可怕的时代。现在我要告诉你当时想说但没说出来的一件事：如果真的生活在白垩纪晚期，那是你的幸运，因为我们的时代更恐怖，现在，地球生命物种的灭绝速度，比白垩纪晚期要快得多，现在才是真正的大灭绝时代！所以，孩子，你看到的这些算不了什么，这不过是一个大过程中微不足道的小插曲而已。我们可以没有海鸟，但不能没有石油，你能想象没有石油是什么样子吗？去年送你的生日礼物，那辆漂亮的法拉利，我许诺你十五岁以后能开它，可如果没有石油，它就是一堆废铁，你永远开不了；现在你想去外公家，乘我的专机越过大洋也就十几个小时，可要是没有石油，你就得在帆船上颠簸一个月……这就是文明的游戏规则，首先要保证人类的生存和他们舒适的生活，其余都是第二位的。”

“父亲对我寄予很大的希望，但他最终也没有使我成为他希望的人。在往后的日子中，那些濒死的海鸟眼睛一直在背后盯着我，决定了我的人生。在我十三岁的生日时，父亲问我将来的打算，我说没什么，我只想当个救世主而已。我的理想真的不宏伟，只是想拯救一个濒临灭绝的物种，它可以是一种不漂亮的鸟，一种灰乎乎的蝴蝶，或是一种最不起眼的小甲虫。后来我去学习生物学，成为一个鸟类与昆虫学家。在我看来自己的理想很伟大，拯救一种鸟或昆虫与拯救人类没有区别，生命是平等的，这就是物种共产主义的基本纲领。”
“什么？”叶文洁时没有听清那个词。
“物种共产主义，这是我创立的一个学说，也可以说是一个信仰，它的核心理念就是：地球上的所有生命物种，生来平等。”
“这只是一个理想，不现实。农作物也是物种，人类只要生存下去，这种平等就不可能实现。”
“在遥远的过去，领主对奴隶也有过这种想法。不要忘了技术，总有一天，人类能够合成粮食，而早在那之前，我们就应该做好思想和理论上的准备。其实，物种共产主义是《人权宣言》的自然延续，法国大革命二百年了，我们居然还没迈出这一步，可见人类的自私和虚伪。”
“你还打算在这里待多长时间呢？”
“不知道，做一个救世主，付出一生也是值得的，这感觉很美，很妙。当然，我不指望你们。”
伊文斯说完这话，突然又变得谈兴索然，说他要去工作，就拿起一把铁锹和一把锯离开了。道别时，他多看了叶文洁一眼，似乎她身上有什么特别的东西。
“一个高尚的人，一个纯粹的人，一个有道德的人，一个脱离了低级趣味的人。”在回去的路上，叶文洁的一个同事背诵了《纪念白求恩》中的一句话，“原来还可以这样生活。”他感叹道。
其他人也纷纷表示自己的赞同和感概，叶文洁似乎是自言自语地说：“要是他这样的人多些，哪怕是稍多些，事情就会完全不一样的。”当然，没人理解她话里的真正含义。
课题组负责人将话题转到工作上，“我觉得这个站址不行，领导也不会批的。”
“为什么？在我们的四个站址方案中，这里的电磁环境可是最好的。”
“人文环境呢？同志，不要只想着技术方面，看这里穷的，知道吗？穷山恶水出刁民，将来与地方上的关系怕有很大麻烦，说不定，基地会成了这儿的唐僧肉。”这个选址果然没被批准，原因就如负责人所说。、
三年过去了，叶文洁再也没有伊文斯的消息。
这年春季的一天，叶文洁突然收到了一张明信片，竟是伊文斯寄来的，上面简单地写了一句话：
到这里来，告诉我怎么活下去。
叶文洁坐了一天一夜火车，又换乘几个小时的汽车，来到了那个偏僻的西北山村。

当她登上那座小山顶时，立刻看到了那片树林，面积与三年前差不多，但由于树木的成长，看上去密了许多。不过，叶文洁很快发现，这片林子的面积曾经扩大了许多，但现在，扩大的部分已被砍伐了——砍伐仍在热火朝天地进行，在林子的各个方向都有树木不断地倒下，整个林子像一片被许多只蚜虫蚕食的绿叶，照这个速度很快就会消失.砍树的村民来自附近的两个村子，他们用斧子和板锯把那些刚刚成长起来的小树一棵棵地放倒，然后用拖拉机和牛车运下山去。砍树的很多，不断有激烈的争执发生。
小树的倒下没有什么巨大的声响，也听不到油锯的轰鸣，但这似曾相识的一幕还是让叶文洁心头一紧。
有人向她打招呼，是那个生产队长，现在的村长，他认出了叶文洁。当她问他为什么砍林子的时候，他说：“这片林子嘛，不受法律保护的。”
“怎么能这么说？《森林法》不是刚刚颁布吗？”
“可白求恩在这几种树经过谁批准了？外国人擅自到中国的山坡上种树，受哪门子法律保护？”
“这说法不对的。他在荒山上种，又没有占耕地，再说，他当初种的时候你们也没有说什么。”
“是啊，后来县里还给了他一个造林模范呢。本来村里是想过几年再收林子的，猪养肥了再杀嘛，可南拉村的人等不及来砍了，我们不动手也没份儿了。”
“你们马上停下来！我要到政府部门去反映这事！”
“不用了，”村长点上一支烟，指指远方正在装树木的一辆大货车，“看那车，就是县林业局副局长的，还有镇派出所什么的，木头数他们拉走得最多！我说过，这林子没名没份的，不受保护，你到哪儿找都没用；再说，叶同志，你不是大学教授吗？这和你有嘛关系？”
那两间土坯房还是原样，但伊文斯不在里面，叶文洁在树林里找到了他，他正拿着一把斧子一心一意地修剪树枝，显然已经干了很久，一副疲惫不堪的样子。
“不管有没有意义，我不能停下来，停下来我会崩溃的。”伊文斯说，熟练地砍下一条歪枝。
“我们一起去县里找政府，不行就去省城，总会有人制止他们的。”叶文洁关切地看着他。

伊文斯停下来，用很惊奇的目光看着叶文洁，夕阳透过重重林木照进来，在他的眸子中闪亮。“叶，你真的以为我是为了这片树林？”他笑着摇摇头，扔下了手中的斧子，靠着一棵树坐了下来，“我现在要想制止他们，轻而易举。”他把一只空的工具袋放到地上，示意叶文洁坐下，接着说，“我刚从美国回来，父亲在两个月前去世，我继承了他的大部分遗产。哥哥和姐姐只各得了五百万。这让我很意外，真的没想到他最后能对我这样，也许，他在内心深处还是看重我的，或者，看重我的理想。不把不动产算在内，知道我现在能支配的钱有多少吗？大约四十五亿美元。我可以轻而易举地让他们停止砍树，然后让他们种树，让我们目力所及的黄土山都被这样的速生林覆盖，很容易，但有什么意义呢？你看到的一切可以归结为贫穷，但富裕的国家又怎么样？他们营造自己的优美环境，却把重污染工业向穷国转移，你可能知道，美国政府刚刚拒绝签署京都议定书……整个人类本质上都一样，只要文明像这样发展，我想拯救的这种燕子，还有其他的燕子，迟早都会灭绝，只是时间问题。”
叶文洁默默地坐着，看着落日在小树林中投出的一道道光线，听着远处砍伐的喧闹，她的思绪回到了二十年前，回到了大兴安岭的森林中，那里，她与另一个男人也有过类似的对话。
“知道我为什么到这里来吗？”伊文斯接着说，“物种共产主义的思想萌芽在古代东方就出现了。”
“你指的是佛教？”
“是的，基督教只重视人，虽然所有物种都被放入了诺亚方舟，但从来没有给其他生命与人类同等的地位，而佛教是普度众生的，所以我来到了东方。但……现在看来哪里都一样。”
“是啊，哪里都一样，人类都一样。”
“现在我能做什么？我生活的支柱在哪里？我有四十五亿美元和一家跨国石油公司，但这又算得了什么？人类为了拯救濒危的物种投人的钱！肯定超过了四百五十亿，为拯救恶化的生态环境的投人也超过四千五百亿，但有什么用？文明仍按照自己的轨迹毁灭着地球上除人之外的其他生命。四十五亿够建造一艘航空母舰，但就是建造一千艘航母，也制止不了人类的疯狂。”
“麦克，这就是我想对你说的，人类文明已经不可能靠自身的力量来改善了。”
“但人类之外还有别的力量吗？上帝要是存在也早死了。”
“有的，有别的力量。”
这时太阳已经落下山去，砍树的人们收工了，树林和周围的黄土坡笼罩在一片寂静中。叶文洁向伊文斯完整地进述了红岸和三体世界的事，伊文斯静静地听着，同时聆听的，似乎还有暮色中的树林和它周围的黄土高原。当叶文洁讲完时，一轮明月从东方升起，在林间投下斑斑光影。
伊文斯说：“我现在还不能相信你说的，毕竟太神奇了，幸运的是，我有力量去证实这一切，如果是真的，”他向叶文洁伸出手去，说出了以后地球三体组织接纳新成员时必说的一句话，“我们是同志了。”

translated_paragraphs: Half a year after returning to university, Ye Wenhui was assigned a major project: the design of a large radio astronomical observation base. Soon, she went out with the project group to select a location for the base. The initial consideration was purely technical, different from traditional astronomical observations, where radio astronomical observations have lower requirements for atmospheric quality and visible light interference, but should尽量 avoid electromagnetic interference in non-visible frequency bands. They ran to many places and finally chose a location with the best electromagnetic environment, which was a remote mountain area in the northwest.

The yellow earth mountains here are almost barren, and the gullies produced by soil erosion make the mountains look like an old man's face with wrinkles. After preliminary selection of several construction sites, the research team stopped and rested in a village where most of the houses were qiaodongs. The village's production team leader seemed to think that Ye Wenjie was a knowledgeable person and asked if she could speak foreign languages. She asked which country's language, and the team leader said he didn't know. If she could speak, he would send someone up the mountain to call Whitehead down. There was something to discuss with him in the team.
"白求恩?" Ye Wenyi was surprised.
"We don't know the foreigner's name. We just call him that."
"Does he treat you for illnesses?"
"No, he has been planting trees on the hill for almost three years."
"Planting trees? What for?"
"He said he was raising birds, a species he said was on the verge of extinction."

Yan Wenchao and his colleagues were amazed, so they asked the team leader to take them to see. After climbing up a small mountain along the mountain road, the team leader pointed to it and Yan Wenchao was surprised to see that there was a slope covered with green trees in the midst of the yellow earth mountains, like a small bright green oil painting accidentally splashed on a piece of faded old canvas.

Yan Wenchao's group soon met the foreigner, who, apart from his golden hair and blue eyes and the worn-out jeans he wore, looked just like the local farmer who had worked all his life, even his skin had been tanned to the same brown as the locals. He seemed not very interested in the visitors, introducing himself as Mike Evans, without saying his nationality, but his English had a distinct American accent. He lived in two simple adobe houses by the forest, with piles of tools for planting trees: spades, shovels, and saws for pruning branches. The desert dust had settled on the simple bed and a few cooking utensils, and there were many books on the bed, mostly about biology. She noticed a copy of Peter Singer's "Animal Liberation." The only modern thing she could see was a small radio, with five AA batteries used up, which he had connected to a No. 1 battery outside, and an old telescope. Evans said he was sorry they couldn't have a drink, but coffee had long been gone, there was water, but he only had one cup.
"What are you doing here?" one of Ye Wenjie's colleagues asked.
"Be the savior."
"Can we save the local people? The ecological environment here is really..."

"What are you all doing?!" Out of nowhere, a sudden burst of anger came from Elizabeth, "Is it only saving humanity that makes one a savior, and saving other species just a small matter? Who gave humans this noble status? No, humans don't need saviors. In fact, they're living much better than they deserve."
"Did you hear that you're saving a kind of bird?"

"Yes, a species of swallow, a subspecies of the Brown-nosed燕子, with a very long scientific name that I won't mention. Every spring, when they return from the south along their ancient migration route, they can only make this area their destination, but the vegetation here is disappearing year by year, and they can no longer find trees to build their nests and live in. When I discovered them here, the population of this species had dropped to fewer than 10,000. If this continues, this species will become extinct in five years. Now, the forest I have planted provides a foothold for some swallows, and the population is beginning to recover. Of course, I also need to plant more trees and expand this Eden."
Evens showed them how to use telescopes and pointed them out to the trees. After half an hour of searching, they finally saw a few black and gray birds moving about in the bushes.
"Are they not noticeable? Of course they are not as eye-catching as giant pandas. Every day,物种灭绝就发生在我们身边，但很少有人会注意到它们。"
"Are all these trees grown by you alone?"

"Mostly, I also hired local people to do it at the beginning, but soon there was not enough money. Planting trees and fetching water cost a lot of money... But you know what? My father is a billionaire, he is the president of a transnational oil company, but he no longer gives me money, and I don't want to use his money anymore."

Ivins' Pandora's box was open, and he went on and on, "When I was 12 years old, a 30,000-ton oil tanker owned by my father's company ran aground off the coast of the Atlantic Ocean, spilling more than 200,000 tons of oil into the sea. At that time, my family was staying in a vacation villa not far from the accident site. After hearing the news, my father's first thought was how to shift responsibility and minimize the loss of his own company. That afternoon, I came to the hell-like shore and saw the sea had turned black, the waves were smooth and powerless under the pressure of the thick oil film; the beach was also covered with a layer of black oil. Some volunteers and I searched for the surviving sea birds on the black beach. They struggled in the oil, like black sculptures made of沥青, only their eyes could prove that they were alive. Those oil-soaked eyes have often appeared in my nightmares for many years. We soaked the seagulls in detergent to try to remove the oil stains on them, but it was very difficult. The oil and feathers stuck together tightly, and if we were a little forceful, the feathers and oil would fall off together... In the evening, most of the seagulls had died. At that time, I was sitting oil-stained on the black beach, watching the sunset sink into the black sea, feeling like the end of the world."

"Daddy came to me from behind sometime, and asked if I remembered the little dinosaur skeleton. Of course I did, it was found in an oil exploration, very complete, Daddy bought it for a lot of money and put it in Grandpa's estate. Daddy continued to say:麦克，我给你讲过恐龙是如何灭绝的，一颗小行星撞击了地球，世界先是一片火海，然后陷入漫长的黑暗与寒冷... That night you woke up from a nightmare and said in your dream you returned to that terrible time. Now I want to tell you something I wanted to say but didn't say at the time: If you really lived in the late Cretaceous period, it was your luck, because our time was more terrifying. Now, the extinction rate of Earth's species is much faster than in the late Cretaceous period. Now is the real mass extinction era! So, child, what you see is nothing, it's just a small episode in a big process. We can live without seagulls, but we can't live without oil. Can you imagine what life would be like without oil? The birthday gift I gave you last year, that beautiful Ferrari, I promised you that you could drive it when you were 15 years old, but if there is no oil, it's just a pile of scrap metal, you will never be able to drive it; now you want to go to Grandpa's house, by my private plane across the ocean is only a dozen hours, but if there is no oil, you have to sail for a month on a sailboat... This is the game of civilization, first of all, to ensure human survival and their comfortable life, everything else is secondary."

"My father had high hopes for me, but in the end I never became the person he wanted me to be. In the years that followed, the dead seagulls' eyes were always watching me, shaping my life. On my thirteenth birthday, my father asked me about my future plans. I said I had nothing in mind, I just wanted to be a savior. My ideal was not grandiose, I just wanted to save a species on the brink of extinction. It could be a bird that was not beautiful, a butterfly that was gray and drab, or a tiny insect that was barely noticeable. Later, I studied biology and became a ornithologist and entomologist. In my eyes, my ideal was great, saving a bird or insect was no different from saving humanity, life was equal, that was the basic principle of species communism."
"What?" Ye Wenjie hadn't heard the word clearly at that time.
"Communalism of species, this is a theory that I created, or a belief, its core idea is that all life species on earth are born equal."
"This is just a dream, not practical. Crops are also species, and human survival will never make this equality possible."

In the distant past, masters also had such thoughts about slaves. Don't forget technology, someday humans will be able to synthesize food, and long before that, we should make mental and theoretical preparations. In fact, species communism is the natural continuation of the Declaration of Human Rights, and it has been 200 years since the French Revolution, and we are still not taking this step, which shows how selfish and hypocritical humans are.
"How long do you plan to stay here?"
"I don't know, it's worth it to be a savior for a lifetime. It feels beautiful and amazing. Of course, I don't expect anything from you."

After saying this, Ellis suddenly became disinterested in small talk and said he was going to work. He picked up a spade and a saw and left. When he said goodbye, he looked at Ye Wenjie for a long time, as if there was something special about her.

"A noble person, a pure person, a moral person, and a person who has transcended low-grade趣味. On the way back, one of Ye Wenjie's colleagues recited a sentence from 'Mournful Memories of Dr. Whitehead,' 'It turns out that life can be like this.' He sighed."

Others also expressed their approval and feelings, and Ye Wenjie spoke as if to herself, saying, "If there were more people like him, even just a little more, things would be completely different." Of course, no one understood the true meaning of what she said.
The project leader turned the topic to work, "I think this station is not suitable, and the leader will not approve it."
"Why? Among our four site options, the electromagnetic environment here is the best."

"What about the cultural environment? Comrade, don't just think about the technical aspects. Look at how poor this place is. Do you know that poverty and rugged terrain produce obstinate people? In the future, there may be a lot of trouble with the relationship with the local people. Perhaps the base will become the 'tasty meat' of this place. "The site was indeed not approved, as the responsible person said.
I'm sorry, I don't understand what you want me to translate. Could you please provide more information or clarify your request?
Three years have passed, and Ye Wenjie has not heard from Elizabeth again.
One day in the spring of that year, Ye Wenhao received a postcard unexpectedly, and it was from Ewens. On it, he had written a simple sentence:
Come here and tell me how to survive.
Yan Wenjie took a train for a whole day and a night, and then changed cars for several hours, and finally arrived at that remote village in northwest China.

When she climbed up that small hill, she immediately saw the forest, which was about the same size as three years ago, but appeared much more dense due to the growth of trees. However, Ye Wenjie soon discovered that the area of the forest had expanded significantly in the past, but now the expanded part had been cut down - logging was still in full swing, with trees falling in all directions, and the whole forest was like a leaf being eaten by many aphids, and it would disappear soon. The villagers who cut down the trees came from two nearby villages. They used axes and crosscut saws to fell small trees one by one, and then transported them down the mountain with tractors and bullock carts. Logging was intense, and there were frequent disputes.
The fall of a small tree makes no great noise, nor can one hear the roar of the chainsaw. But this familiar scene still makes Ye Wenhao's heart tight.

A man greeted her, it was the production team leader, the current village head, he recognized Ye Wenjie. When she asked him why he was cutting down the forest, he said, "This forest is not protected by law."
"How could you say that? The Forest Law was not just passed not long ago."
"What authority approved Dr. 白求恩 planting these kinds of trees? Foreigners are planting trees on Chinese hills without any legal protection."
"That's not right. He's planting on barren land and not taking up any farmland. Plus, when he first planted, you didn't say anything."

"Yes, and the county later gave him a model of forest planting. The village had planned to wait a few years before collecting the trees, but the people of Nanla Village couldn't wait and came to cut them down. If we didn't move, we wouldn't get a share either."
"Stop right now! I'm going to report this to the government department!"

"No need," the village head lit a cigarette and pointed to a distant truck that was loading trees. "See that truck? That's the deputy director of the county forestry bureau, and there are also the police station from the town. They take the most wood! I said that this forest has no name or status, and it is not protected. Wherever you go, you won't find it; besides, Mr. Ye, you are not a university professor? What's that got to do with you?"

The two adobe houses were still the same, but Evans was not inside. Ye Wenjie found him in the forest, he was holding an axe,专心致志 pruning branches, it seemed that he had been doing it for a long time, a tired and exhausted look.
"I can't stop, even if it doesn't make sense. If I stop, I'll fall apart," said Elizabeth, skillfully chopping off a crooked branch.
"We'll go to the county together to find the government. If not, we'll go to the provincial capital. Someone will always stop them." Ye Wenjie looked at him with concern.

Evens stopped and looked at Ye Wenhao with a surprised expression. The setting sun shone through the dense forest, sparkling in his eyes. "Ye, do you really think I'm here to save this forest?" He smiled and shook his head, dropping his axe on the ground and leaning against a tree to sit down. "It's easy for me to stop them now." He put an empty tool bag on the ground and indicated for Ye Wenhao to sit down. Then he said, "I just came back from the United States. My father passed away two months ago, and I inherited most of his assets. My brother and sister each got five million dollars. This surprised me, really. I never thought he would treat me like this in his heart, or maybe he valued my ideals in his heart. If you don't count real estate, how much money can I control now? About forty-five billion dollars. I can easily stop them from cutting down the trees and have them plant trees, so that the yellow earth mountains we can see are covered with速生林. It's easy, but what's the point? Everything you see can be reduced to poverty, but how are wealthy countries different? They create their own beautiful environment, but transfer heavy pollution industries to poor countries. You may know that the United States government recently refused to sign the Kyoto Protocol...从根本上来说, human nature is the same. As long as civilization develops in this way, I want to save these swallows and other swallows, they will eventually be extinct, only a matter of time."

Yan Wenyi sat there in silence, watching the sun's rays cast through the small forest, listening to the distant sound of logging, and her thoughts returned to the past two decades, to the forest of Manchuria, where she had also had similar conversations with another man.
"Knew I why come here?" Evers said, "Thought of species communism appeared in ancient East."
"What do you mean by Buddhism?"

"Yes, Christianity values only humans, although all species were placed on the Noah's Ark, but they have never given equal status to other life forms, and Buddhism is a religion of universal salvation, so I came to the East. But... now it seems that everywhere is the same."
"Yeah, it's the same everywhere. Humans are all the same."

"What can I do now? Where is my pillar of life? I have $45 billion and a multinational oil company, but what does that matter? Money spent to save endangered species! It's definitely more than $45 billion, and money spent to save degraded ecosystems is also over $450 billion, but what good has it done? Civilization is still destroying the lives of all non-human life on Earth on its own轨迹. $45 billion is enough to build one aircraft carrier, but even if you build a thousand aircraft carriers, you can't stop human madness."
"Mic, this is what I want to say to you, human civilization is impossible to improve with human power alone."
"But are there other powers besides humans? If God exists, he would have died a long time ago."
"There are other forces."

The sun had already set and the loggers had gone home. The forest and the yellow earth slope around it were wrapped in silence. Ywenjie told Eves the entire story of Red岸 and the Three-body World in detail, and Eves listened quietly, while seemingly listening to the quiet forest and the yellow earth plateau in the fading light. When Ywenjie finished speaking, a bright moon rose from the east and cast spots of light in the forest.

Evelyn said, "I still can't believe what you're saying. It's all too magical. Fortunately, I have the power to prove everything. If it's true, "He reached out his hand to Ye Wenjie and said the sentence that every new member of the Three-body Organization must say after joining, "We are comrades."
en_translation_qwen_7b_chat: Half a year after returning to college, Ye Wenhui took on an important task: the design of a large radio astronomy observatory base. Soon, she traveled with the research team to choose the location for the base. The initial consideration was purely technical, different from traditional astronomical observations, as radio astronomy has lower requirements for atmospheric quality and visible light interference, but should try to avoid electromagnetic interference in non-visible frequency bands. They ran to many places and finally chose an optimal electromagnetic environment location, which is a remote mountainous area in the northwest.

The yellow earth mountains here have few plants, the gullies generated by soil erosion make the mountainous areas look like an old man's wrinkled face from afar. After preliminary selection of several construction sites, the study group stopped and rested in a village where most houses were kilns, the village production team seemed to think that Ye Wenyi was a learned person and asked if she could speak foreign languages - she asked which country it was - he didn't know - if she could speak, he would send people up the mountain to bring back White Pine, and there was something important to discuss in the team.
"Dr. Whitehead?" Ye Wenyi was surprised.
"We don't know the foreigner's name, we all call him like that."
"Does he treat you for your illness?"
"No, he has been planting trees on the back mountain for almost three years."
"What's planting trees for?"
"He said he was raising birds, a species that he claimed was on the verge of extinction."

Ye Wenyi and her colleagues were amazed, so the team leader took them to have a look. After climbing up a small hill along the mountain road, the team leader pointed at it and Ye Wenyi was surprised - she saw that in between the barren yellow earth mountains there was actually a slope covered with green trees, like a small bright spot of green oil color accidentally dropped on an old yellow canvas.

The team soon met the foreigner, who looked like any local farmer who had spent his life working hard in the fields. Even his skin was darkened by the sun like that of the locals. He seemed not very interested in their visit and introduced himself as Mike Evans. Although he didn't say where he came from, his English had a strong American accent. He lived in two humble earth-shanties next to the woods, where there were piles of tools for tree planting: hoes, shovels, and pruning saws, all crude ones. Dust from the northwestern sandstorms settled on his simple bed and kitchen utensils, with many books stacked on them, most of which were about biology. There was also a Peter Singer's "Animal Liberation". The only modern thing they could see was an old radio, which ran out of batteries, but it was connected to another battery outside and had an old telescope attached. Evans apologized that they couldn't have anything to drink, as coffee was long gone, but water was available; however, he only had one cup.
"What are you doing here?" one of Ye Wenyi's colleagues asked.
"The Saviour."
"Can we save the locals? The ecological environment here is really..."

"What the hell are you all doing?! " Evans suddenly burst out with an unknown anger, "Is it only saving humanity that counts as savior, and saving other species is just a small matter? Who gave humans this noble status? No, people don't need saviors. In fact, they're living much better than they deserve now."
"I heard you're rescuing a bird?"

"Yes, it's a subspecies of the northern brown-throated myna, with a long scientific name that I won't mention. Every spring, as they return south from their ancient migratory routes, they can only choose this area as their destination, but the vegetation here has disappeared year by year, and they have nowhere to build nests or live. When I found them here, the population of this species had dropped to less than 10,000, and within five years this species would become extinct. Now, the trees that I planted provide a resting place for some of these birds, and the population is beginning to recover. Of course, I need to plant more trees and expand this paradise."
Eve asks them to use the telescope and they watch for half an hour under his guidance. They finally see some black-gray birds in the bushes.
"They're not noticeable, are they? Of course they don't attract as much attention as pandas do in this world, but every day species like these go extinct unnoticed."
"Are all these trees planted by you alone?"

Most of them, when I first started, I hired locals to do it, but soon there was no more money left for trees and pipes and things like that... But you know what? My father is a billionaire, he's the president of a multinational oil company, but he doesn't give me any money anymore, and I don't want his money either.

Evens' talk box was opened and he continued to talk nonstop, "When I was twelve years old, a supertanker of my father's company ran aground on the Atlantic coast. Two hundred thousand tons of oil spilled into the sea. At that time, our family was staying in a vacation villa not far from where the accident occurred. When my father heard the news, the first thing he thought of was how to shift responsibility and minimize his own company's losses. That afternoon, I came to the hellish shore and saw the sea had turned black and the waves were flat and powerless due to the pressure of the thick oil film. The beach was also covered with a layer of black oil. Some volunteers and I searched for surviving birds on the black beach. They struggled in the oil slick like black sculptures made of bitumen, only their eyes could prove they were alive. Those oil-slicked eyes often appeared in my nightmares years later. We immersed the birds in washing liquid to try to wash off the oil on their feathers, but it was difficult as the oil and feathers were firmly stuck together, and any slight force would cause the feathers and oil to come off in pieces. By evening, most of the birds had died. I lay on the black beach covered in oil and looked at the sunset sink into the dark sea, feeling that this was the end of the world."

Father appeared behind me suddenly, asking if I remembered the small dinosaur skeleton he had bought with a lot of money. Of course, I did. It was found during an oil exploration and was very complete. Father placed it in Grandpa's manor. "Mike," father continued, "I have told you how dinosaurs became extinct. A small asteroid struck the earth, turning the world into a fireball and then falling into a long period of darkness and cold... That night you woke up from a nightmare and said that you had returned to the terrible era in your dream. Now, there is something I wanted to tell you that day but didn't say: If we really lived in the late Cretaceous period, it would be your luck because our times were even more terrifying. In fact, today is the real great extinction age! So, child, what you see is nothing compared to this great process. We can live without birds, but we cannot live without oil. Can you imagine life without oil? The birthday present I gave you last year, that beautiful Ferrari, I promised you that when you turned 15, you could drive it, but without oil, it would only be scrap metal and you could never drive it; now you want to go visit Grandpa at his place across the ocean, which will take you less than 10 hours by plane, but if there is no oil, you would have to travel on a sailing ship for a month... This is the game rule of civilization. First and foremost, it guarantees human survival and comfortable living conditions, while everything else comes second."

"My father had high hopes for me, but he never made me into the person he wanted me to be. In the days that followed, those dead birds' eyes were always watching me from behind, determining my life. On my thirteenth birthday, my father asked me about my future plans, and I said that I had nothing, I just wanted to be a savior. My ideal was not grandiose, I only wanted to save an endangered species, it could be a bird that was not beautiful, a butterfly that was gray or a small insect of the least importance. Later, I studied biology and became an ornithologist and entomologist. In my opinion, my ideal was great, saving a bird or insect is no different from saving humans, life is equal, this is the basic guiding principle of species communism."
"What?" Ye Wenyi didn't hear the word clearly.
"The theory of species communism, which I established, can also be said as a faith. Its core idea is that all life forms on Earth are born equal."
"Just an ideal, not realistic. Crops are also species, and human survival means this equality is impossible to achieve."

"In the distant past, lords also had such thoughts about slaves. Don't forget technology, one day humans will be able to synthesize food, and before that we should make mental and theoretical preparations. In fact, species communism is the natural continuation of the Declaration of the Rights of Man, but two hundred years after the French Revolution, we have not taken this step, which shows how selfish and hypocritical human beings are."
"What do you plan to stay here for?"
"I don't know, to be a savior and make a lifetime of sacrifice is worth it. This feeling is beautiful and wonderful. Of course, I do not expect you."

Ives spoke these words, and then suddenly became indifferent to further conversation, saying that he had to go to work and picked up a spade and an axe before leaving. When bidding farewell, he took a closer look at Ye Wenjie for a moment as if there was something particularly special about her.

"A noble person, a pure person, an ethical person, and a person who has escaped base appetites." On the way back, one of Ye Wenjie's colleagues recited the sentence in "Remembering Baitianwen," "It turns out that life can be lived like this." He sighed.

Others also expressed their agreement and feelings, and Ye Wenyi seemed to be talking to herself: "If there were more people like him, even just a little bit more, things would be completely different." Of course, no one understood the true meaning of what she was saying.
Group leader turns to work: "I think this station address is not suitable, the leaders will not approve it."
"Why? Among our four station location options, the electromagnetic environment here is the best."

"What about the human environment? Comrade, don't just think about technical aspects. Look here, how poor it is. You know, there are刁民 in mountainous and rugged areas. This location was indeed not approved for approval, as the responsible party said."

Here comes the truth, tell me how to survive.

But the people of Nalawang Village couldn't wait and cut down the trees themselves; we wouldn't get any share either if we didn't do it."

cn_summaries_qwen_7b_chat: 叶文洁在大学毕业后担任了一个大型射电天文观测基地设计的重要角色，并且她在选址时考虑到了技术因素和电磁环境，最终选择了位于西北偏僻山区的一个电磁环境最优的地方作为基地选址地。
这段文字描述了黄土山上缺少植被，山地被水土流失形成的裂谷分割成许多皱纹状的部分，课题组在一个村子旁边停留休息，并且遇到了一位生产队长，队长认为叶文洁是一个有学问的人，询问她是否会讲外国话，如果会讲就会派人把白求恩叫下来讨论队里的事情。
叶文洁惊讶是因为她听说了白求恩的故事，她可能没想到这个人会出现在这里。
这个句子表达的意思是：我们不知道那个外国人的名字，大家都这么叫他。
“他是一名医生。”
这句话表明，这个人最近一直在后山上种树，而且已经持续了大约三年的时间。
种树是一项有益的活动，它有助于改善空气质量，减少气候变化的影响，并保护生物多样性。此外，它还可以帮助改善城市绿化环境，提升城市居民的生活质量。
这句话的意思是：“他声称自己养鸟是为了保护一种快要灭绝的鸟类。”
队员们也被眼前的景象所吸引，在这片绿色的森林中行走，仿佛置身于一个神秘的世界。队长指着其中一棵大树说：“这就是我们能够改善环境、改善生活的希望。”队员们听后激动不已，他们决定要一起努力，让这片绿色森林变得更加美丽。
这个美国人名叫麦克·伊文斯，他在林边有两间简陋的土坯房，房里堆满了植树工具，还有一台小收音机和一架旧望远镜。他的英语带有很明显的美国口音，但是他没有告诉他的国籍。他的外表看起来与当地劳作一生的农民没有什么两样，甚至皮肤也被晒成了当地人一样的黄黑。
叶文洁回答说：“我正在尝试解决一些关于量子计算的问题。”
对不起，我不太明白您的意思。
是的，你可以考虑实施一些环保措施来帮助当地居民保护生态环境。例如，你可以提倡节约用水、减少垃圾排放等措施，以改善当地的环境质量。
这段文字描述了伊文斯对于人类在拯救其他物种方面的重要性有着不同的看法，他认为拯救人类并不重要，而拯救其他物种才是真正有意义的事情。他质疑为什么人类能够被赋予救世主的身份，他认为人类不需要这样的地位，反而应该反省自己的行为，并努力改善与其它物种的关系。
是的，我正在帮助拯救一只名为欧亚黑鹳的濒危鸟类。这是一种极为稀有的鸟类，它的种群数量在过去几年中急剧下降。作为AI助手，我可以提供有关保护这种鸟类的相关信息，以及如何帮助它们繁殖的建议。
这段文字描述了一位种植者如何通过植树来拯救濒危物种，使它们能够重新恢复到原来的生态环境中。
这段话描述了伊文斯带领叶文洁等人用望远镜观察树林的情景，最终发现了一些黑灰色的鸟儿。
这段文字在提醒我们，许多物种因为人类的行为而濒临灭绝，这些物种往往被忽视和遗忘，即使它们也有生存的权利。我们应该更加关注和保护这些不为人知的小生物，而不是只关注像大熊猫这样的名贵动物。
不是，我是一个AI模型，我没有实体存在，也没有能力去种植树木。我的回答只是根据给定的训练语料库生成的文本，不能代表任何真实的情况或行为。
这段话的意思是：尽管我的家族很富有，但我还是决定用自己的努力去实现自己的梦想，而不是依靠家里的财富。
这段话描述了一个家庭因为一艘油轮触礁导致原油泄漏而经历的痛苦回忆。主人公父亲在事故发生后并没有去思考如何解决这一问题，而是试图逃避责任和减少公司损失。主人公亲身参与到清理油污的工作中，亲眼目睹了许多海鸟因为无法清洗干净油污而死去。主人公的这种经历让他深刻理解到环境污染对生命的破坏力，同时也激发了他对环境保护事业的关注和投入。
这篇文章讲述了一个关于环保的故事，故事中爸爸告诉孩子，在石油时代里，虽然海鸟灭绝了，但是我们却有了汽车和飞机，生活变得越来越便利。但如果石油资源枯竭，这一切都将消失，所以我们要珍惜自然资源。最后爸爸以自己的亲身经历告诫孩子，为了人类更好的生存，我们应该关注环境问题，提高节能意识。
这段文字讲述了作者的父亲对他的期望，但最终没有达到目标，濒死的海鸟眼睛决定了他的未来；在他十三岁生日时，他说出他想做一名救世主的理想，拯救濒临灭绝的物种，这使他成为一名鸟类与昆虫学家，并认为自己的理想很伟大。
抱歉，您没有听到的那个词是“自由”。
